elements.title: a normal Japanese woman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Shohei Ohtani married "a normal Japanese woman" (pictured) who used to play professional basketball?

elements.title: black-headed tailorbird (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the color of a black-headed tailorbird's throat was thought to depend on sex, but later turned out to depend on age?

elements.title: John Morin Scott (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that John Morin Scott, the mayor of Philadelphia, responded to the 1842 Lombard Street riot by mostly arresting black victims?

elements.title: argue in favor of women's superiority (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a 17th-century male-authored book was adapted to argue in favor of women's superiority?

elements.title: Bill Shearer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bill Shearer, a leader of the segregationist George Wallace's 1968 presidential campaign, also advocated for ballot access for the Socialist Workers Party?

elements.title: in many works of fiction (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in many works of fiction, the asteroid belt is the remnants of a destroyed planet?

elements.title: Nandipha Magudumana (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the celebrity doctor Nandipha Magudumana was imprisoned and investigated for twelve crimes, including murder connected to a fugitive's prison escape?

elements.title: Spitfire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the release of the EP Spitfire crashed the servers of the online music store Beatport?

elements.title: Descartes' theorem (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the discovery of Descartes' theorem in geometry came from a too-difficult mathematics problem posed to a princess?
